text: have you ever received a compliment and
acted super awkward about it hey great
job on your presentation yesterday I
learned so much oh yeah yeah it was
whatever well you're actually not alone
one of hbr's authors conducted a study
of more than 400 people and found that
nearly 70% associate compliments with
feelings of embarrassment or discomfort
he observed that in most cases that
discomfort we feel comes from Surprise
our body is physiologic iCal response to
unexpected events follows a pretty
predictable pattern when it comes to
receiving compliments it might look like
this first we freeze even if we're
hearing good news it can feel
emotionally intense if we're caught off
guard after that initial surprise we
start to look for answers we may try to
figure out why someone said something
nice about us and that can be confusing
if the compliment conflicts with some
negative view we already have about
ourselves next we start to shift our
perspective to try and Shuffle that new
information we're receiving into our
existing outlook for a lot of us this
means brushing aside the compliment or
reducing its value finally we respond or
we share what we think out loud
sometimes I'm good at random stuff the
next time someone compliments you just
remember that they're sharing their
experience and not yours even if it
catches you off guard or you don't
necessarily agree with it a good first
step is just to say thank you
